column1: Sentani International Airport (Indonesian: Bandar Udara Internasional Sentani) (IATA: DJJ
column2: ICAO: WAJJ) is an airport serving Jayapura
column5: on the island of New Guinea. The name of this airport is taken from a lake nearby. The airport is located 25 km West of Jayapura city. The airport resides at an elevation of 289 feet (88 m) above mean sea level. It has one runway designated 12/30 with an asphalt surface measuring 3
column7: 843 ft Ã— 148 ft). Sentani International Airport is the only part of the complex still in use as an airfield today. It is used as the principal entry point into the Indonesian half of the island of Papua. The airport serves as the main port of entry into the island of Indonesian New Guinea. The air traffic is roughly divided between flights connecting to destinations within the Papua province and flights linking Papua to other parts of Indonesia. Sentani Airport is also the main base for several aviation organizations
